website_summaries.verdict: While this trailer may be a little small for some, buyers love its 100-pound weight capacity and smooth ride.
pros: Available in a choice of red-black or yellow-gray
Great look and a very smooth ride
Quickly and easily folds for storage
cons: Some felt this option was a little on the small side
Cover fits a bit tight, while the overall material is of lower quality

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product very well-made Took minutes to assemble, Love the fact that all the Carter pins are tethered so you cannot lose them . I have attached a bike roof rack so I can tow it behind my scooter since I do not drive a car this will make it easier for me and less dependent on friends first solo ride today everything work really well
customer_reviews.author: Gary R.

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Rad Rover E-bike and this is the perfect add on for it. I often ride to the grocery and can put all of my goods in it. It rolls as if it was on air. It took only minutes to assemble and put it to use. Schwinn quality.
customer_reviews.author: Murf the Surf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Cargo Hauler
customer_reviews.text: This Day Tripper Cargo Trailer is easy to set up and lightweight. The construction is sturdy. The bicycle mount was easy to install. It is the same mount that came with the Schwinn Rascal Pet Carrier ( Note: The wheel "axles" are slightly longer than on the Rascal, so the wheels are not interchangeable. I have goatheads on my trails, so I upgraded the tubes and tires on this trailer and my Rascal. Tires:  Tubes:
customer_reviews.author: ABQ Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This little trailer is just what i expected , tuff , and very easy to handel , as you can see , in the pic , i took it out in the foothills , to the middle of nowere , and tested it out , with about a 60 pound payload . It worked perfect , I am happy i added this to my gear.
customer_reviews.author: jeff honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: Defective wheel axl.
customer_reviews.text: I just got it, opened it and guess what? one of the wheel axles is shorter than the other and it will not allow me to connect said shorter wheel the carriage. Great, wait another week to see if customer service will get back to me. Just pay the extra cash for a Burley. I can't believe the metallurgy is not inspected.
customer_reviews.author: Jujubee

customer_reviews.title: Good Schwinn quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good Schwinn quality product. Easy to set up and works well. I ride a Magnum Ui5 electric bike and ride up to 22 mph speeds. It tails gracefully behind me. I use it for grocery trips, and it works well for that. I wish it was easier to lock up when I'm at the store, thought. It's an easy release, so someone could pretty easily unlatch it and drag it off with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I have about 1000 miles on this trailer. I basically use for hauling most anything that will fit in or on it with straps. It has served me very well. The weakest thing in this trailer is the top cover latches. Both have broken in the first month I owned it. The are non replaceable as far as I can tell. One side on both broke in the same place. They still latch, but weakly now. When I do finally kill this trailer from overuse, I will buy the newer model eventually. Very well made, except the latches.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Evers

customer_reviews.title: Bigger & Lighter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to pull beach chairs, umbrellas, etc to the beach - about a half mile trek. I could fit two chairs, one umbrella, beach bag and towels into it. After piling it on I held it all together with bungee cords to keep it in place. If I had to do again I would look for one slightly larger and lighter in weight if possible. You do feel the cart behind you when you pedal . All in all it did the job for me and the price was OK.
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Great grocery hauler
customer_reviews.text: This cart pulls very easily. Sometimes I look back to ensure it is still there. I can carry plenty of groceries with it. Two large reusable shopping bags and a metal basket plus a large U-lock and cable. It would hold four soft bags easy. While not necessarily a negative, I will point out that the bags can't be filled higher than the cart or the cover won't clip down. I typically buy something flat like a frozen pizza to place over my shopping bags or just shift items around if needed. The cart pulls fine even when heavily loaded. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Brett Williams (author)

customer_reviews.title: Almost don't even know it's there!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my ebike and it works great. Mounts and dismounts in seconds. Folds up very small for storage. The whole thing assembled only weighs 21.6lbs. Good quality wheels roll very nicely and don't wobble at all. Anything over 20mph and you can kinda feel the bumps pulling on the trailer, but it's not bad. Had to make a few modifications. The axle on mine is 14mm and the mount bracket provided was 12mm so i had to hog the hole out a little. Was also kind of a pain because the side it mounts on is the side that the wires come out of the hub. Not the manufacturers' fault but still inconvenient to install the mount.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Brunelle

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a relatively good—capacity trailer.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for another cargo trailer found on Amazon that had provided decent service, but the bearings went out on one wheel, and the cost of replacing wheels, tubes & tires came close to the price of this trailer. Although slightly smaller with regard to inside dimensions, it suits the purpose of loading beach bag, small cooler, etc., and strapping beach chairs to the top & pedaling to the beach. Build quality is reasonable, the trailer is lightweight, and pulls smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark In Jax

customer_reviews.title: Pulls nicely, hard to complain for $70
customer_reviews.text: Seems well designed and well built. 2 small issues when I unpacked it - the tires are directional (they have an arrow showing travel direction) but both are mounted the same way. I'll have to break one down and reverse it if I decide I care that much. Also, one of the latching clips on the arm that goes across the front of the trailer was broken, but I called the 800 number in the paperwork and they sent me a replacement right out. Pulls nicely, hard to complain for $70..
customer_reviews.author: Dan Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: NO WAY THIS ITEM HAS BEEN USED!!! HIGHLY DEFECTIVE!!!DANGEROUS DEFECTIVE TIRES
customer_reviews.text: 1. TIRES ARE DEFECTIVE HUGE BALD PATCHES OF MISSING RUBBER 2. SCRATCHES ALL OVER THE RIMS 3. A RIP IN THE COVER FOR THIS PRICE I SHOULD HAVE WALKED INT O WALMART RATHER THAN DEAL WITH AN USED ABUSED ITEM THIS WAS A GIFT !! POSTING PICTURES ASAP!!!!!!!!! NOT HAPPY DO NOT RECOMIND!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ~*~ Israel Awakened ~*~

customer_reviews.title: No quality control- Unusable out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This trailer was sent defective from the factory with frozen wheel bearings on one of the axles. Both rims are out of round and one of the plastic frame connectors is cracked. I sent an email to the manufacturer for help and they replied with a confirmation number as listed below: 8/26/2020 at 8:53 PM -- Your request (331358) has been received and is being reviewed by our support staff.I I have received no other response as of today and I do not expect to get one after waiting this long. Read the low rating reviews and see that I am not the only one this has happened too.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this cargo trailer
customer_reviews.text: My 88-year old father-in-law (who no longer drives a car) put this together, attached it to his electronic bicycle and off he goes to the grocery store! It's lightweight and very easy to maneuver around with it on the bike. He loves it and it helps him be independent for small, local errands. It's easy to attach and re-attach. The cover is great to keep groceries inside. When he buys bulkier items that won't fit inside the cover, he uses a small elastic cargo net to keep everything inside.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Used for Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to help me transport groceries from the store to home, since I have recently made a habit of riding my bike for such adventures. I also have a tripod dog and am a dog trainer. I knew this trailer could handle it, and we tested it out withour dog, Ubuntu, and voila! Instant dog transport! lol I definitely don't recommend this with every dog, but our guy enjoyed the hell out of a ride around the neighborhood! Great, sturdy trailer, and it keeps the balance well. Ubuntu definitely recommends!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Such a cool little trailer
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cargo trailer to carry photography and video gear to the school where I'm a web manager and content creator. The Segway MiniPro fits nicely in the trailer, side by side with a big Domke F1-style camera bag for video gear and a lighter stills camera bag. NOTE: While assembling, you may be bumfuzzled by the positioning of the connector that attaches to your bike's real axle - it looks like there's no way the trailer will align straight behind the bike. Trust me, the spring joint in the bike arm will do its magic and the trailer WILL track directly behind. Don't worry your head about it - it works
customer_reviews.author: George Beinhorn

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put up and take back down, lightweight, and sturdy. I use it actually for my dog. It's cheaper than buying one intended for animals or the children kind. Does great so far for me. Even used it to haul an AC window unit from the store home which is about 2 miles. Only thing is if the canopy was adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: An excellent little trailer
customer_reviews.text: An excellent little trailer, this works really well and is pretty sturdy. I managed to get a flat tire and had a fun time replacing it (not) so make sure you have spare tubes of the correct size on hand if you live in an area where you have rough roads or ride on trails. The size is really quite good and this is the only trailer I've yet found which I could fit a full depth rack mount server in the back of.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Ease of installation
customer_reviews.text: This trailer's wheels can be attached or removed easily. Once the wheels removed, I can store it at home as it is. The bearings and axles are sturdy. I don't know whether it is my chance, the wheels were installed in the correct direction opposed to one of early review. The paint and weld job is well done. Amazon did a good job, although I didn't clicked "send in packaging that doesn't reveal what is inside", the trailer has came well packaged and undamaged. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Melike Erol

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My bike is my main source of transport and commute, I was sick of carrying all my groceries in a hiking pack every week. This trailer has worked perfectly for my needs and it holds quite a bit. I'm sure I've pushed it's limits but I have no way of weighing it. It has yet to fail me. I've taken it through rain, snow and sunshine. It's not waterproof, but it does have a cover so nothing flies away. I would recommend buying a long cable to string through the trailer tires when you lock up your bike so no-one can take it easily. If you live in a sketchy city like me.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great for beach trips!
customer_reviews.text: We go to San Diego every year with our bikes, and like to beach lounge in comfort, with a tent, umbrella, beach chairs, coolers, etc. This thing rocks. You can also detach it from your bike and use it as a wagon to roll all of your stuff into the beach! Very easy to assemble/disassemble, fold and put away. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jerusha

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful design! I can't imagine a better trailer (I've owned three others over the years), it's compact, yet has a huge capacity. Well made wheels, and logical attachment. Made from durable components, I've hauled 100 pounds in it several times. Folds up to the smallest possible size for EZ storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying a Schwinn trailer and I am once again extremely impressed with the quality of their products. Takes no time at all to put together. It’s sturdy and it looks good. I would only say keep an eye on the tires, because they tend to lose a bit of air pressure between trips, but nothing problematic. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Camille V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for instruments!
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to transport instruments to and from school. This trailer has been perfect! We have 2 boys playing instruments this year....one playing the trumpet and one playing the trombone. Both instruments fix perfectly in the trailer and days that they don't take the instruments, it works great to carry their backpacks. It is easy to take on and off when my son doesn't need the trailer too. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Cargo Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I love this Schwinn Cargo Trailer. It fitted to my Schwinn Hybrid Bicycle flawlessly. It was very easy to assemble. You don't need any wrenches, screwdrivers, or any other tools to assemble it. I used it right away after putting it together to do a short run grocery shopping at a nearby market. It rode so smoothly along with my Schwinn Bicycle. I really recommend anyone to get this excellent well-built and sturdy Cargo Trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive customer service
customer_reviews.text: I sent the Schwinn customer service an email three months and one month ago for a replacement part and still haven't received a reply back. A buckle broke which holds one of the two support brackets in place. It broke the first time I was assembling the trailer, which means it's much weaker than the buckles on grocery carts. The other one hasn't broken yet, but when it does, the trailer will be unusable. I use the trailer to haul my groceries once a week, and it can fit a small week's worth of groceries for two people. It also collapses, so I can put it in the grocery cart while i shop.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Scooter SUV/Grocery getter.
customer_reviews.text: My SUV is spending more time in the driveway. I did not like this on my mtb the bracket was not good as dead weight on the rear suspension and it was too much of a PITA to take on and off, so I mounted it to my new escooter, works great, just need to take wide turns when it is on. Makes it a breeze to jot down to the store for beer runs or to the farmers market.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Moore

customer_reviews.title: The trailer is great, but customer service is awful
customer_reviews.text: When I was assembling the trailer, one of the prongs for the crossbar latch broke. The trailer is usable, but it is not fully locked. In the meantime, I have called customer service several times. They have been "in training" or, at times of high call volume, just say to call back another time with a "Good-bye." These are call center tactics I have experienced with shady companies, not what I would expect with a Schwinn name. Pacific Cycle (the company) has also not responded to my email. But this if you want a nice, little bike trailer. Don't if you might ever have anything wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris T.

customer_reviews.title: Assembled incorrectly, broke immediately, seller never responded.
customer_reviews.text: When I got the daytripper, it broke when I assembled it because a piece was put together crooked. A paper in the package said we should contact the company. I've contacted the company in several ways to try and remedy and they've never returned any of my communications. I wish I would have returned it immediately through Amazon. They are a reputable company so I assumed they would take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen A M Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great little cargo trailer
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying, this trailer is great! I bought it mainly to do laundry and haul big stuff that wont fit in a backpack and it's been perfect. I've successfully pulled about 40 pounds of laundry no problem and it holds a medium sized duffle bag perfectly with all my clothes stuffed. One thing about trailers in general is that from a stand still it takes a bit of work to build up momentum, and for going up hill you'll deffinatly count on those granny gears. One minor complaint is that it rattles a tiny bit. All together I couldn't be more happy, good deal for ~$100
customer_reviews.author: Sean P. Stearns

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is less than 10 minutes. Fill with air and that's it. Took for a spin when it arrived. Bought 3 - 12 packs of soda, 1 gal of milk, 3 bags of ice and a 24 pack of bottle beer and still had room. There was very little drag but once you get rolling you kind of forget it's there. Price was pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: ORLANDO RODRIGUEZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome versatile trailer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this mainly for my 11 year old son to bike his large cello to and from school. I was concerned with it being too heavy bc he has to bike home all uphill for a mile but this trailer is lightweight and super easy for him. I have been using it as well to bike to the grocery store. And during the winter this will fold away nicely as to not take up much space in the garage. Very happy about this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Well-built and solid value
customer_reviews.text: I use this for CostCo runs. It's strong, stable and seems to be very durable/reliable. The only thing I'd like to see changed is that it could use 2.5 - 3.5 more inches of internal capacity.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: 2,363 miles around the Balkan region with this beast!
customer_reviews.text: I have only amazing things to say about this trailer. I ordered the Schwinn Day Tripper Cargo Trailer in February and embarked on a three month bicycle tour around the Balkan region. This trailer survived 2363 miles (3804 km), carrying 70-80 pounds the entire way. The Balkan region is known for its awful roads but this trailer took the bumps and holes like a champ. Throughout the trip I had no issues besides a single flat tire, which is expected on a trip of this length. I am a big believer in Schwinn products after this experience. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad H.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality ‘Cool As’ Bike Trailer
customer_reviews.text: I love to ride my bike daily, so why not save on short trips in my car by simply riding my bike with this cool light weight trailer to go fetch groceries and other ‘bits and bobs’ around town. The coolest part about this trailer is it folds up and I put it on the bottom rack of a shopping cart when I’m grocery shopping; I do so, for security, while my bike is outside locked up with a U-lock. I’ve had this well-made bike trailer for six months, it looks like it’s brand-new and I’ve got it hooked on my bike nearly everyday ‘out and about’ on my errand runs.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Holmes

customer_reviews.title: This was a bit of a disappointment. The frame is sturdy and it rolls well ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit of a disappointment. The frame is sturdy and it rolls well behind my bike but the material is thin and cheap. I accidentally hit a curb and turned my trailer on it’s side. I stopped IMMEDIATELY yet a substantial tear was the result. A slightly heavier canvas would make this trailer a five star.
customer_reviews.author: W. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great for small cargo.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to connect, I purchased extra connecters for other bikes. It is small, but I like the cover and it's not hard to ride with. Only issue is the material unraveling a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Well once I opened the box I just new I was going to love it. I live 1/4 mole from my grocery store and love to bike there. So this just made it easier to do my shopping and get everything I need. It is only me and my girlfriend so a week's work the groceries fit. I also use to to do laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Best money I have spent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and and ease to hook up to my bike. If you don’t have one, get one.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I use this for bike rides with my elderly dog
customer_reviews.text: I have a 17 year old dog, and this is perfect for putting him in the wagon and taking him for a ride behind my bike. I got a pad to fit the bottom, and cut a pool noodle to cushion the metal frame. He is about 20 pounds, and it tracks nicely behind my bike--can hardly feel him back there. Everyone I pass by on the bike path comments on it! I can also use it for a small cooler and chairs to take to neighborhood concerts (when they start back up again--arrrgh!)
customer_reviews.author: Graciebird

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, and can (kind of) upgrade space.
customer_reviews.text: Great little cart. I just got it and I am more than pleased that it handles well under high-speed conditions. I ride at 20 to 30 mile per hour on average and it held steady the entire 3 mile ride home after picking up from the post office. I noticed some of the reviews complained a little on storage so with it I bought an Iris weather tight 62 liter storage box.... it fits perfectly into the trailer and adds about 6 inches of height to fit even more into the trailer.... I recommend not riding at high speeds with box in trailer unless it has a decent amount of weight or is tied down.
customer_reviews.author: Vulpes Lupus

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough. Seems to work as advertised. I was worried about the coupling device and my axel set up with the quick release axel, but wasn’t a problem. Had it loaded with 50 lbs on my ebike, didn’t even notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. Easy to remove and reattach to the bike and effortless to pull. Loaded it up with groceries, the dog, you name it. Definitely a good buy as long as you don’t abuse it
customer_reviews.author: Elijah J.

customer_reviews.title: I was concerned...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this for groceries and laundry, etc behind a gas-powered scooter. My concerns were whether it would be stable and how the connector would be adaptable. both issues proved to be mute. The "hitch" bolted up perfect to my GY6 scooter and, as apprehensive as I was, it was 100% stable on 5-mile trips at up to 35 MPH. I'm not condoning this trailer being used for applications it wasn't designed for; I'm just sharing my experience.
customer_reviews.author: DArtagnan

customer_reviews.title: Stuck with lopsided wobble wheels
customer_reviews.text: Lopsided and wheels wobble. I probably got a defective trailer but the return window is less than a month. I took it out of its box and put it together to use for the 4th of July. The return deadline was the 5th, I'm finally able to get online and it's now the 6th. 😏😒 I thought I had till the 9th.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for picking up cans and trash on bike rides!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my grandson, who collects cans and trash along our country roads. Now he can collect double or triple each bike trip compared to his previous way of hanging plastic grocery bags from his handlebars. He loves it and can collect on longer trips before heading home. Highly recommends!
customer_reviews.author: JulieH

customer_reviews.title: Be careful if you use a QR skewer
customer_reviews.text: Good so far; I've used it only a little bit. Seems somewhat heavy, but well-built. The instructions regarding using a quick-release rear wheel skewer could be a little more complete; some skewers could be damaged if one is not careful, due to the recessed design of the attaching bracket. I had to switch to a skewer that fit that design better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hook up and go
customer_reviews.text: Took this out on my Fiido L2 e bike took to top speed this cargo trailer did fine no tipping. You'll have to take corner slow and wide.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to receive my new trailer. This thing is amazing. For starters it’s not that heavy weighing in at about 21lbs. Instructions were super simple to read and understand. It assembled quickly with no tools needed. The only tool needed is when you install the receiver portion of the trailer hitch to the bicycle. Like I said super simple. I haven't rode with it quite yet but will soon.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: MY husband adapted it with a upright frame. Will now haul beach chairs, umbrellas, cooler and other stuff with out difficulty
customer_reviews.author: tt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Trip
customer_reviews.text: Took it up 6 miles uphill to a campsite. Works great and carries a ton of weight. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Shunsuke Takeda

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew to haul things from m.j those to his. It's just the perfect size and he loves it's easy to put together and easy to install and remove from bike.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It's a sweetheart if you're not hauling cargo
customer_reviews.text: Pick up boxes and packages at the post office seems you can make them all fit
customer_reviews.author: Frenchie

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I got this so my son can pull it behind his bike to carry his saxophone to school. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The trailer was easy to assemble That's what I liked about that ((The only downfall is the link I wish it was 3 ft long)) other than that everything is good 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Phillip H

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, good size. Not made for easy turning, as it take a very wide area to turn.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Yeah it was $106 with tax but it's definitely a lot better than the $70 one even though both are made in China this one's made better and worth the extra $30
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey K

customer_reviews.title: Solid built very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Solid built very pleased it’s always nice to get something that is better than you Expected can’t wait to take it out for a test ride very easy assembly and disassembly major reason I bought this more pics to follow
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: appears to be great quality.easy to assemble,
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble,very good quality,dog loves it !!! and i get more exercise !!
customer_reviews.author: william h.

customer_reviews.title: Bike riding with my two dogs
customer_reviews.text: Took my two dogs out in this and they loved it. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with the item...just didn't need after ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my dog and works great. He has flipped out of if a few times but that was from him moving around. It folds down small so fits fine under my bed for storage. I did break one of the clips right away but that was my fault really
customer_reviews.author: Julian Botero

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little trailer. Good quality, especially for the price. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: DGreeezyAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great trailer you don't even feel it behind you. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Clemons

customer_reviews.title: It's a very good trailer. But...
customer_reviews.text: it is does make a lot of noise when being towed. I ended up having to add rubber washers to the wheels to make them quieter and I also had to drill a couple of holes and rivet the plastic bottom down to make it quieter. But overall a very good trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Well made only wish it had a little more spring other than just the rubber wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together!!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to put together and the fact that is folds up is great for packing to take when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Louie R

customer_reviews.title: It's made strong
customer_reviews.text: Not worry about back pack when riding your bike just use the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Papasmurf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and build.
customer_reviews.text: This trailer is durable and the quality is excellent for the cost of $99. It folds flat easily. The only downside is that the trailer does not remain in one-piece when folded flat, as the wheels need to be removed. The wheels detach easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it came with a piece of carpet that ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if it came with a piece of carpet that Velcro'd to the bottom. My dog slips and slides when riding in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy McAfee, co-author of Sharpening Your Point

customer_reviews.title: A real steal
customer_reviews.text: This little trailer is very nice for such a low price. It pulls easily and I've used it to go grocery shopping. Fun times

product_meta.title: Schwinn Day Tripper Cargo Bike Trailer for Toddlers, Kids, Folding Frame, 16 Inch Tires, Universal Bicycle Coupler, Quick Release Wheels, Red, Yellow
product_meta.description: Founded in 1895, Schwinn is an American icon, building some of the best-known and best-loved bicycles of all time. From its very beginning in Chicago, Illinois, the Schwinn mission has been to develop bicycles that allow people to experience the confidence and freedom that comes from riding a bike. Take along your gear for the ride with the Schwinn Day Tripper Cargo Trailer. The wide frame provides large towing and storage capacity, while the two-wheel design limits torque placed on your bicycle for unhindered performance. A unique folding-frame design and quick-release wheels pack up neatly for compact storage and transport. For added versitility, enjoy the ease of one-time installation with the universal coupler that easily attaches to almost any bicycle. 16-inch air-filled tires with molded rims provide a ride that's always smooth, while interior D-rings allow you to strap down your cargo, providing extra security and improved performance. This bike trailer ships ready to be assembled. The wheels measure 16 inches.
